summary: A for-statement is a loop that iterates based on a control variable and a condition.
details: The scope of the assignee is anywhere in the enclosing function.
The assignee is alive precisely during an activation of the enclosing function.
The type of the assignee variable will be primitive-type int.
The initializer will be unboxed, if necessary.
The condition will be unboxed, if necessary.
The modifier will be unboxed, if necessary.
The body of a loop can contain break-statements.
The body of a loop can contain continue-statements.
The body of a loop can contain redo-statements.
static-checks: The assignee cannot share its name with another variable declared in the same scope.
The type of initializer must be assignable to type int.
The type of condition must be assignable to type boolean.
The type of modifier must be assignable to type int.
example-1: module Main in examples;%0A%0A@Start%0Adefun main (args : String[]) : void%0A{%0A    for (i = 0; i < 5; i + 1)%0A    {%0A        (F::print %22X = %22);%0A        (F::println i);%0A    }%0A}
